description.summary: An authentic Italian pasta dish with a creamy egg sauce, crispy pancetta, and Pecorino Romano cheese. This classic Roman recipe is simple yet elegant, featuring minimal ingredients combined perfectly.

preparation.step: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta until al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
While pasta cooks, fry the diced pancetta in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Pecorino Romano cheese, and black pepper until well combined.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water. Drain the cooked pasta.
Add the hot drained pasta to the skillet with pancetta off the heat. Toss to combine.
Pour the egg mixture over the pasta while stirring constantly. The residual heat will cook the eggs into a creamy sauce.
If the sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta water a splash at a time to reach desired consistency.
Serve immediately topped with additional Pecorino Romano and cracked black pepper.
